Detailed Description

Type describing payload element of ZCL Read Reporting Configuration Response command.

Definition at line 949 of file zcl.h.

Field Documentation

uint8_t ZCL_ReadReportingConfigurationResp_t::status

If the attribute is not implemented on the sender or receiver of the command, whichever is relevant (depending on direction), this field shall be set to UNSUPPORTED_ATTRIBUTE. If the attribute is supported, but is not capable of being reported, this field shall be set to UNREPORTABLE_ATTRIBUTE. Otherwise, this field shall be set to SUCCESS.

Definition at line 956 of file zcl.h.

uint8_t ZCL_ReadReportingConfigurationResp_t::direction

The direction field specifies whether values of the attribute are reported (0x00), or whether reports of the attribute are received (0x01).

Definition at line 959 of file zcl.h.

ZCL_AttributeId_t ZCL_ReadReportingConfigurationResp_t::attributeId

If the direction field is 0x00, this field contains the identifier of the attribute that is to be reported. If instead the direction field is 0x01, the device shall expect reports of values of this attribute.

Definition at line 963 of file zcl.h.

uint8_t ZCL_ReadReportingConfigurationResp_t::attributeType

The Attribute data type field contains the data type of the attribute that is to be reported.

Definition at line 970 of file zcl.h.

ZCL_ReportTime_t ZCL_ReadReportingConfigurationResp_t::minReportingInterval

The minimum reporting interval field is 16 bits in length and shall contain the minimum interval, in seconds, between issuing reports of the specified attribute.

Definition at line 973 of file zcl.h.

ZCL_ReportTime_t ZCL_ReadReportingConfigurationResp_t::maxReportingInterval

The maximum reporting interval field is 16 bits in length and shall contain the maximum interval, in seconds, between issuing reports of the specified attribute.

Definition at line 977 of file zcl.h.

uint8_t ZCL_ReadReportingConfigurationResp_t::reportableChange[1]

The reportable change field shall contain the minimum change to the attribute that will result in a report being issued. This field is of variable length. For attributes with 'analog' data type the field has the same data type as the attribute.

Definition at line 982 of file zcl.h.

ZCL_ReportTime_t ZCL_ReadReportingConfigurationResp_t::timeoutPeriod

The timeout period field is 16 bits in length and shall contain the maximum expected time, in seconds, between received reports for the attribute specified in the attribute ID field. If more time than this elapses between reports, this may be an indication that there is a problem with reporting. If this value is set to 0x0000, reports of the attribute are not subject to timeout.

Definition at line 989 of file zcl.h.
